author: Special Correspondent
text:
Secretary Information and Tamil Development Department and Monitoring Officer for Thanjavur district M. Rajaram on Friday reviewed the preparations for Mahamaham event scheduled here for February 22. He took stock of the development works undertaken to meet the demands of an expected 45 lakh pilgrim influx during the ritual.

Mr. Rajaram inspected the temporary toilets established at Soolamangalam panchayat, development and beautification of the Varaha Perumal Temple tank and its surroundings, taken up at a cost of Rs. 60 lakh, work at the Pottramarai tank, desilting of the Mahamaham tank to dump fresh river sand for the benefit of the pilgrims, pavement work in various places and other development projects being implemented for the convenience of the pilgrims.

Mr. Rajaram, in the company of Collector N. Subbaiyan, reviewed the progress of various works related to Mahamaham with officials from the Revenue, Development, Hindu Religious and Charitable Endowments Department, Kumbakonam Municipality and other agencies of the government and urged the officers to expedite all works.
title: Preparation for Mahamaham reviewed
